Award.AwardTitle: The 9th USA-China Chemical Engineering Conference, Beijing, China, October 15-19, 2017

Division.LongName: Div Of Chem, Bioeng, Env, & Transp Sys

Award.AbstractNarration:
This grant is to provide travel support for US-based researchers to attend The 9th Sino-USA Joint Conference of Chemical Engineering (SUCE 2017), to be held in Beijing, China, on October 15 - 19, 2017. The theme of the conference is Green Chemical Engineering and a special emphasis will be placed on Chemical Engineering yielding environmental benefits. The organizing committee, which consists of distinguished researchers with a broad range of skills in chemical engineering, will provide for a vibrant and diverse atmosphere that will foster exchange of ideas on research and education. It is anticipated that approximately 35 US-based researchers will receive partial travel support to attend this conference.

Global challenges related to depletion of nonrenewable energy resources, climate change, environmental pollution, and population growth are creating a need for the development of green and sustainable manufacturing technologies. The three-and-half-day technical conference will feature invited plenary and keynote lectures, oral presentations, two plenary discussion panels, one forum and a poster session. The conference will emphasize not only the role of chemical engineers in the development of sustainable chemical and energy processes, but will also explore the frontiers of Chemical Engineering research and the fundamental principles that are needed to tackle these challenges. The US-based conference participants supported by this grant will have the opportunity to network with leading researchers from China and exchange ideas about the current status and future directions in research and education. They will benefit from state-of-the-art reviews and presentations by leading experts and by debating controversial points with their peers. The meeting will also provide an opportunity for interaction and cooperation among industrial and academic researchers. The organizers plan to give special consideration to young or junior faculty members from U.S. Universities. Female and under-represented minorities will also receive special consideration. The conference will address global challenges with potentially significant benefits to society.

Project Outcomes Report (200-800words):

 

The NSF grant was a travel grant for partially defraying the travel costs of academic speakers to The 9th Sino-USA Joint Conference of Chemical Engineering (SUCE 2017), held in Beijing, China, on October 15 - 19, 2017.  A summary and the outcomes of the Conference are given below.

The theme of the 9th conference was “Green Chemical Engineering”, with a special emphasis placed on chemical engineering yielding environmental benefits, while also exploring the frontiers for developing fundamentals needed to tackle these challenges. The conference helped fostering new and substantial collaborations between engineers and scientists from both academic institutions and industrial/business sector from USA and China.

The conference was chaired by Dr. Norman N. Li, President, NL Chemical Technologies, from the US side, and Co-Chaired (from China) by Dr. Tianwei Tan, President of Beijing University of Chemical Technology, China. The Conference was co-sponsored by Chinese Academy of Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, the Chemical Industry & Engineering Society of China  (CIESC), and the American Institute of Chemical Engineers (AIChE).

 

While all aspects of Chemical Engineering were covered, the following topics were the main subjects of the conference:  

 

  1. Bioengineering and Biotechnology
  2. Catalysis and Reaction Engineering
  3. Food and Pharmaceutical Technologies
  4. Energy
  5. Particle and Fluidization Technology
  6. Petrochemicals and Fine Chemicals
  7. Process Development and Optimization
  8. Thermodynamics and Transport Phenomena
  9. Separation Technology

10.  Materials and Nanotechnology

11.  Environmental Chemical Engineering and Green Processing

12.  Management Science for Research and Development Poster session

A brief summary of the outcomes of the conference is as follows:

 

1) Scientific exchange of new research results and development in the field of clean energy and clean processes which will lead to further advancement of science and technology in clean energy/process technologies

2) Enhanced relationship between the two chemical engineering/biotechnology and chemistry communities of the US and China

3) Fostered new collaborations between the two countries

4) The direct communication facilitates the development and expansion of the potentially vast markets in China and Asia for U.S. chemical/biochemical products and processes.
